title: People are being drugged and raped with GHB-laced lubricant, according to investigation
text:
A new British documentary reveals the gruesome pattern of rapists who use a popular party drug to incapacitate gay and bisexual men and broadcast attacks online.

GHB, a drug used to heighten sexual pleasure and euphoria that is also commonly known as a date rape drug, is at the center of widespread attacks that are broadcast on the dark web, according to a four-part joint investigation by BuzzFeed News and Channel 4 Dispatches.

"Dispatches: Sex, Drugs and Murder" was partly based on a survey of 2,700 gay and bisexual men in Britain conducted earlier this year that found more than one in four of the men said they had been sexually assaulted after taking the drug.

Of the 2,700 responses, half said they had passed out after taking Gamma-Hydroxybutyric Acid, or GHB, and 93% said they knew of someone who had done so.

The drug has risen as a deadly threat in the country's "chemsex" scene, where gay and bisexual men experiment with doses of crystal meth, GHB, and mephedrone to heighten sexual arousal. However, the weaponizing of GHB, which poses a serious risk of overdose when taken with alcohol, has raised concerns among LGBT health charities to advocate for cautious use.

Read more: A dangerous drug called Catnip Cocktail is on the rise — and it's driving people mad

The series, which was published in parts by BuzzFeed News ahead of the series' premiere, found that the drug is available for sale over Facebook and was often administered through lubricant to unsuspecting victims at "chemsex" parties.

Adrian Hyyrylainen-Trett, a member of the LGBT advisory group to Britain's Metropolitan Police, told Reuters that he had become comatose "10-12 times" after taking the drug and was "pretty sure" he had been sexually assaulted during those times, but had no proof.
